definition[0]: to change someone’s appearance so that people cannot recognize them
example[0]: He escaped across the border disguised as a priest.
example[1]: Maybe you could disguise yourself as a waiter and sneak in there.
definition[1]: to change the appearance, sound, taste etc of something so that people do not recognize it
example[2]: There’s no way you can disguise that southern accent.
example[3]: a letter bomb disguised as a musical greetings card
definition[2]: to hide a fact or feeling so that people will not notice it
example[4]: Try as he might, Dan couldn’t disguise his feelings for Katie.
example[5]: The speech was seen by many as a thinly disguised attack on the president.
example[6]: There’s no disguising the fact that business is bad.
definition[3]: something that you wear to change your appearance and hide who you are, or the act of wearing this
example[8]: She wore dark glasses in an absurd attempt at disguise.
